question.text: Which of the following blood plasma proteins is correctly matched with its function?

options.text: Albumin : Maintain water level and osmolarity of blood
Globulin : Helps to provide antibody mediated immunity  <math><mo>(</mo><mtext>AMI</mtext><mo>)</mo></math>
Fibrinogen : Helps in coagulation of blood.

solution.text:
There are three main types of plasma proteins:
  • Albumin: It retains water level in plasma, therefore, maintains osmolarity.
  • Globulin: It is the protein of plasma as antibodies or immunoglobulin molecules that provide AMI.
  • Fibrinogen: This plasma protein is converted into fibrin threads by thrombin enzyme at the time of blood coagulation/clotting.
